text: Hyundai Engineering & Construction Co., a South Korean builder, publicly announced on Nov. 23 that it has received a letter of award (LOA) from Cirebon Energi Prasarana (CEPR), a local energy facility operator, to build a coal-fired power plant in Cirebon, Indonesia. Under the deal for Indonesia’s Cirebon II 1000MW CFPP (USC) project, the company will build a 1,000 MW coal-fired power plant and 500kV transmission lines and expand substations along the coastal line of Java, an island 200 kilometers east of Jakarta. As the supervisor of the construction, Hyundai E&C will be in charge of supplementary equipment and boiler installment and civil engineering works. The construction will be completed within 58 months from its groundbreaking. Also, the company will get 677.4 billion won (US$584.22 million) from the US$727 million (842.96 billion won) deal that was won by Hyundai E&C consortium. Never miss another article!
